When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
```{r}
library("tidyverse")
```


```{r}
collisions_migration_weather_spring_fall_dataset <- read.csv("data/collisions_migration_weather_spring_fall_dataset.csv")
```

```{r}
collisions_no_scaled <- collisions_migration_weather_spring_fall_dataset %>% 
  select(!(starts_with("scaled")))
```

```{r}
collisions_date_sep <- collisions_no_scaled %>% 
  separate(col="date", into = c("month","day","year"), sep = "/") %>% 
  select(!day) %>% 
  mutate(month=as.factor(month))
```

```{r}
collisions_date_sep %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=month,y=count))+
  geom_boxplot()+
  coord_cartesian(y=c(0,30))
```
